intro: Drosanthemum intermedium, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with a distinctive, daisy-like appearance, typically blooming in spring and summer. Its leaves are fleshy and gray-green, adapted to store water and reduce transpiration. Drosanthemum intermedium is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
